word_mean: 复发，再发：某一疾病显然停止后的重新发生。参见recrudescence

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin relaps- 'slipped back', from the verb relabi, from re- 'back' + labi 'to slip'. Early senses referred to a return to heresy or wrongdoing

entry.tran: 故态复萌;重新陷入;倒退
entry.def: If you say that someone relapses into a way of behaving that is undesirable, you mean that they start to behave in that way again.

example.ex: 'I wish I did,' said Phil Jordan, relapsing into his usual gloom...
example.tran: “我要是那样做了就好了，”菲尔·乔丹说道，又像往常一样消沉起来。

example.ex: It is by no means clear that the financial markets will not relapse into panic.
example.tran: 现在还不能确定金融市场不会重新陷入恐慌。

entry.def: If a sick person relapses, their health suddenly gets worse after it had been improving.

example.ex: In 90 per cent of cases the patient will relapse within six months.
example.tran: 90%的病人在6个月内会再次发病。

means.word_mean: 1. a failure to maintain a higher state

sentences.sentence: "Those who recidivate are often minor criminals"

means.word_mean: 再度恶化;旧病复发；故态复萌

sentences.en: After making some progress, he suffered a relapse.
sentences.cn: 他的病好了一点,又复发了。

sentences.en: A wide range of emotionally stressful events may trigger a relapse.
sentences.cn: 多种令人情绪紧张的事情都可能引起旧病复发。

sentences.en: Even in relapse there will be times when the patient’s general condition improves.
sentences.cn: 即便在复发期间，病人仍会有好转的时候。

sentences.en: Cameron had relapsed into silence again.
She stopped using drugs for a month, but then relapsed.
sentences.cn: 她一个月没吸毒, 但后来又吸起来了。
